Row.Text: The discovery of a natural wonder gives Scouts bonus experience. Natural wonders also give an adjacency bonus to Holy Site districts. All adjacent tiles receive +2 Appeal.
Two tile natural wonder that can be found on coastal terrain and provides +3 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Science] Science. Major adjacency bonus to the Campus district.
Two tile natural wonder. It appears with Cliffs adjacent to water and provides +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +2 [ICON_Food] Food. Improvements cannot be placed on it.
One tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +5 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +1 [ICON_Science] Science, and Fresh Water.

Two tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture. Units heal completely if they heal for one turn adjacent to the Dead Sea. Does not provide Fresh Water.
Three tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to adjacent tiles. Religious units who move next to Mount Everest ignore Hills for the rest of the game.
Two tile impassable natural wonder. It appears on coastal terrain and provides +2 [ICON_Science] Science to adjacent tiles.
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_Food] Food to adjacent tiles.
Four tile natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Three tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to adjacent tiles.
Two tile impassable natural wonder. Doubles the terrain yields of all adjacent tiles.
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Science] Science to adjacent tiles.
Two tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Science] Science to adjacent tiles.
